intro: Koeleria salzmannii subsp. cossoniana, commonly known as the Cosson's koeleria, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, blue to purple flowers. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
